condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: 2.2. By 2021, government programmes are supported to scale up high impact innovative interventions to reduce HIV transmision and vulnerability among adolescents (10-19 years) (Second Decade),which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Hiv # General, Hiv Prevention, Hiv Prevention (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children, adolescents, and pregnant women use quality, accessible, and proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions.

title.narrative: Zambia 2019 Annual Results Reporting (Major contributions and drivers of results)
Zambia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
2019 Zambia: Outcome evaluation of the investment in institutional community and individual capacity development
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

description.narrative: A total of 717,933 HIV tests were conducted among adolescents 10-19 years with an increasing trend in number of HIV tests in a month. Up to 98% of adolescents diagnosed with HIV were initiated on ART. The number of UNICEF supported adolescent friendly spaces in health facilities increased from 179 in 2018 to 210 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

actual.value: 2019:The national MIS produces age-disagregated data on HIV for all districts on a quarterly basis

title.narrative: The national MIS produces age-disagregated data on HIV for all districts on a quaterly basis

actual.value: 2019:HIV testing data disaggregated by age (using five-year age bands) and sex

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of age- and sex-disaggregated data on HIV testing and counselling among adolescents 10-19 years and by sex
Existence of National HIV and Prevention, PMTCT, Treatment and Care Strategy
Number of health facilities with UNICEF supported Adolescent Freiendly Spaces (AFS)
2.2. By 2021, government programmes are supported to scale up high impact innovative interventions to reduce HIV transmision and vulnerability among adolescents (10-19 years) (Second Decade)

sector.narrative: Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
HIV Prevention programs for adolescents including Key population such as condom programming, VMMC and PreP
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination
HIV and sexuality education for adolescents
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
